intro: Covellia radiata, commonly known as the radiate covellia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the showy yellow-orange inflorescence, which consists of both ray and disk flowers. Covellia radiata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
